item.title: Large-scale quantization of trace I: Finite propagation operators
item.description: arXiv:2506.10957v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Inspired by parallel developments in coarse geometry in mathematics and exact macroscopic quantization in physics, we present a family of general trace formulae which are universally quantized and depend only on large-scale geometric features of the input data. They generalize, to arbitrary dimensions, formulae found by Roe in his partitioned manifold index theorem, as well as the Kubo and Kitaev formulae for 2D Hall conductance used in physics.
item.dc:creator: Matthias Ludewig, Guo Chuan Thiang

item.title: The odd spectral localiser via asymptotic morphisms and quasi-projections
item.description: arXiv:2506.17143v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We describe the index pairing between an odd K-theory class and an odd unbounded Kasparov module by a pair of quasi-projections, supported on a submodule obtained from a finite spectral truncation. We achieve this by pairing the K-theory class with an asymptotic morphism determined by the unbounded Kasparov module. We interpret the spectral localiser of Loring and Schulz-Baldes as an instance of such an index pairing.
item.dc:creator: Yuezhao Li, Bram Mesland
